body:
### Problem

nvim sets an incorrect file path when using `:cd` or `autochdir` to change the directory to file name containing double slashes. The file name is treated like the double slash is the beginning of the path: So `C:/code/proj/translation/input/en-ca//from-translator-2025-12-22.po` becomes `C:/from-translator-2025-12-22.po`.

I would expect that it normalizes duplicated slashes into a single slash or maintains the double slash.


### Steps to reproduce

Simplest repro:
```
:edit C:/code/proj/translation/input/en-ca//from-translator-2025-12-22.po
:echo expand("%:p")
:cd %:p:h
:echo expand("%:p")
```
Output shows the path change:
```
C:/code/proj/translation/input/en-ca//from-translator-2025-12-22.po
c:/from-translator-2025-12-22.po
```

----

Also occurs with `gf` and `autochdir` given c:/code/log.log file:
```
Loading PO file: C:/code/proj/translation/input/en-ca//from-translator-2025-12-22.po
```
C:/code/proj/translation/input/en-ca//from-translator-2025-12-22.po exists but can be empty.

```
nvim --clean +"set autochdir" c:/code/log.log
/input<CR>gf
:echo expand("%:p")
```
Output: `c:/from-translator-2025-12-22.po`

You can see that the path is incorrect. This mismatch causes lots of issues.

(same result if `shellslash` is set.)

Also occurs in neovim 0.11.1.

Both of these setups work in vim:
```
vim -u DEFAULTS +"set autochdir shellslash" c:/code/log.log
vim -u DEFAULTS +"set autochdir" c:/code/log.log
```

### Expected behavior

We should continue editing the same file. Possibly the file path should have normalized path names.

`:echo expand("%:p")` should output `C:/code/proj/translation/input/en-ca/from-translator-2025-12-22.po` and that should be the file we're editing.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no, 9.0.1576

### Operating system/version

Win11

### Terminal name/version

Command Prompt

### $TERM environment variable

not set

### Installation

scoop
title: :cd truncates paths containing double slashes
